title: Generic Pseudoclosure Spaces, Pseudointerior Spaces, and Pseudoneighborhoods
content:
For any base set, ` B ` , an arbitrary mapping of subsets to subsets can be called a pseudoclosure (pseudointerior) function, ` K ` , with its dual of a pseudointerior (pseudoclosure), ` I `, related by the involution in ~ dssmapfvd . As ` K ` gains properties of the closure (interior) function of a topology on ` B `, so does its dual gain corresponding properties of the interior (closure) function of that topology.

As ` ( ~P B ^m ~P B ) ~~ ( ~P ~P B ^m B ) ` there is also a natural isomorphism which maps from ` I ` to ` N ` (and likewise for ` K ` and ` M ` , introduced below) which identically gains the properties of the neighborhood function of a topology (modified and restricted to operate on single points). A function dual to ` N ` , which Stadler and Stadler refer to as a convergent function, is represented by ` M ` in this section.

Based on this and the early treatment of topology in Seifert and Threlfall, it seems reasonable to define a pseudotopology as defined in terms of its base set and one of these functions with theorems treating the equivalence of the other definitions and adding topological structure if enough properties hold true.

blocks.name: sscon34b
blocks.content: Relative complementation reverses inclusion of subclasses. Relativized version of ~ complss . (Contributed by RP, 3-Jun-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm sscon34b(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wa(wss(c0, c1), wss(c2, c1)), wb(wss(c0, c2), wss(cdif(c1, c2), cdif(c1, c0))))
} = {
  impbid2(wa(wss(c0, c1), wss(c2, c1)), wss(c0, c2), wss(cdif(c1, c2), cdif(c1, c0)))
  sscon(c0, c2, c1)
  syl5ib(wa(wss(c0, c1), wss(c2, c1)), wss(cdif(c1, c2), cdif(c1, c0)), wss(c0, c2), wss(cdif(c1, cdif(c1, c0)), cdif(c1, cdif(c1, c2))))
  sscon(cdif(c1, c2), cdif(c1, c0), c1)
  sseq12d(cdif(c1, cdif(c1, c0)), cdif(c1, cdif(c1, c2)), c0, c2, wa(wss(c0, c1), wss(c2, c1)))
  adantr(wss(c0, c1), wss(c2, c1), wceq(cdif(c1, cdif(c1, c0)), c0))
  biimpi(wss(c0, c1), wceq(cdif(c1, cdif(c1, c0)), c0))
  dfss4(c0, c1)
  adantl(wss(c0, c1), wss(c2, c1), wceq(cdif(c1, cdif(c1, c2)), c2))
  biimpi(wss(c2, c1), wceq(cdif(c1, cdif(c1, c2)), c2))
  dfss4(c2, c1)
}

blocks.name: rcompleq
blocks.content: Two subclasses are equal if and only if their relative complements are equal. Relativized version of ~ compleq . (Contributed by RP, 10-Jun-2021.)

blocks.name: or3or
blocks.content: Decompose disjunction into three cases. (Contributed by RP, 5-Jul-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm or3or(wff w0, wff w1) {
  |- wb(wo(w0, w1), w3o(wa(w0, w1), wa(w0, wn(w1)), wa(wn(w0), w1)))
} = {
  3bitr4i(wo(w0, w1), w3o(wa(w0, w1), wa(w0, wn(w1)), wa(wn(w0), w1)), wo(wa(w0, w1), wxo(w0, w1)), wo(wa(w0, w1), wo(wa(w0, wn(w1)), wa(wn(w0), w1))))
  orbi2i(wa(w0, w1), wxo(w0, w1), wo(wa(w0, wn(w1)), wa(wn(w0), w1)))
  excxor(w0, w1)
  pm2.61i(wb(wo(w0, w1), wo(wa(w0, w1), wxo(w0, w1))), w0)
  2thd(w0, wo(w0, w1), wo(wa(w0, w1), wxo(w0, w1)))
  orc(w0, w1)
  mpi(w0, wo(wa(w0, w1), wxo(w0, w1)), wo(w1, wn(w1)))
  exmid(w1)
  orim12d(w0, w1, wn(w1), wa(w0, w1), wxo(w0, w1))
  pm3.2(w0, w1)
  syl6ib(w0, wn(w1), wxo(w0, w1), wn(wb(w0, w1)))
  ex(w0, wn(w1), wn(wb(w0, w1)))
  con2i(wa(w0, wn(w1)), wb(w0, w1))
  sylib(wb(w0, w1), wn(wa(w0, wn(w1))), wi(w0, w1))
  biimp(w0, w1)
  iman(w0, w1)
  3bitr3d(wn(w0), wo(w0, w1), wo(wa(w0, w1), wxo(w0, w1)), w1, wxo(w0, w1))
  syl6bb(wn(w0), w1, wxo(w0, w1), wn(wb(w0, w1)))
  con2bid(wn(w0), w1, wb(w0, w1))
  syl5bb(wn(w0), wb(w0, w1), wn(w1), wb(w1, w0))
  bicom(w0, w1)
  bibif(w0, w1)
  bicomi(wn(wb(w0, w1)), wxo(w0, w1))
  df-xor(w0, w1)
  biorf(w0, w1)
  syl(wn(w0), wb(wxo(w0, w1), wo(wa(w0, w1), wxo(w0, w1))), wn(wa(w0, w1)))
  con3i(w0, wa(w0, w1))
  simpl(w0, w1)
  biorf(wa(w0, w1), wxo(w0, w1))
  3orass(wa(w0, w1), wa(w0, wn(w1)), wa(wn(w0), w1))
}

blocks.name: andi3or
blocks.content: Distribute over triple disjunction. (Contributed by RP, 5-Jul-2021.)

blocks.name: uneqsn
blocks.content: If a union of classes is equal to a singleton then at least one class is equal to the singleton while the other may be equal to the empty set. (Contributed by RP, 5-Jul-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm uneqsn(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wb(wceq(cun(c0, c1), csn(c2)), w3o(wa(wceq(c0, csn(c2)), wceq(c1, csn(c2))), wa(wceq(c0, csn(c2)), wceq(c1, emptycls)), wa(wceq(c0, emptycls), wceq(c1, csn(c2)))))
} = {
  pm2.61i(wb(wceq(cun(c0, c1), csn(c2)), w3o(wa(wceq(c0, csn(c2)), wceq(c1, csn(c2))), wa(wceq(c0, csn(c2)), wceq(c1, emptycls)), wa(wceq(c0, emptycls), wceq(c1, csn(c2))))), wcel(c2, universe))
  3bitrd(wcel(c2, universe), wceq(cun(c0, c1), csn(c2)), w3o(wa(wceq(c0, csn(c2)), wceq(c1, csn(c2))), wa(wceq(c0, csn(c2)), wceq(c1, emptycls)), wa(wceq(c0, emptycls), wceq(c1, csn(c2)))), wa(wss(cun(c0, c1), csn(c2)), wss(csn(c2), cun(c0, c1))), wa(wa(wss(c0, csn(c2)), wss(c1, csn(c2))), wo(wss(csn(c2), c0), wss(csn(c2), c1))))
  a1i(wcel(c2, universe), wb(wceq(cun(c0, c1), csn(c2)), wa(wss(cun(c0, c1), csn(c2)), wss(csn(c2), cun(c0, c1)))))
  eqss(cun(c0, c1), csn(c2))
  anbi12d(wcel(c2, universe), wss(cun(c0, c1), csn(c2)), wss(csn(c2), cun(c0, c1)), wa(wss(c0, csn(c2)), wss(c1, csn(c2))), wo(wss(csn(c2), c0), wss(csn(c2), c1)))
  a1i(wcel(c2, universe), wb(wss(cun(c0, c1), csn(c2)), wa(wss(c0, csn(c2)), wss(c1, csn(c2)))))
  bicomi(wss(cun(c0, c1), csn(c2)), wa(wss(c0, csn(c2)), wss(c1, csn(c2))))
  unss(c0, csn(c2), c1)
  bitr2d(wcel(c2, universe), wss(csn(c2), cun(c0, c1)), wo(wss(csn(c2), c0), wss(csn(c2), c1)), wcel(c2, cun(c0, c1)))
  syl5rbb(wcel(c2, universe), wo(wss(csn(c2), c0), wss(csn(c2), c1)), wcel(c2, cun(c0, c1)), wo(wcel(c2, c0), wcel(c2, c1)))
  elun(c2, c0, c1)
  orbi12d(wcel(c2, universe), wcel(c2, c0), wcel(c2, c1), wss(csn(c2), c0), wss(csn(c2), c1))
  snssg(c2, universe, cun(c0, c1))
  syl5bb(wcel(c2, universe), wa(wa(wss(c0, csn(c2)), wss(c1, csn(c2))), wo(wss(csn(c2), c0), wss(csn(c2), c1))), w3o(wa(wceq(c0, csn(c2)), wceq(c1, csn(c2))), wa(wceq(c0, csn(c2)), wceq(c1, emptycls)), wa(wceq(c0, emptycls), wceq(c1, csn(c2)))), w3o(wa(wa(wss(c0, csn(c2)), wss(c1, csn(c2))), wa(wss(csn(c2), c0), wss(csn(c2), c1))), wa(wa(wss(c0, csn(c2)), wss(c1, csn(c2))), wa(wss(csn(c2), c0), wn(wss(csn(c2), c1)))), wa(wa(wss(c0, csn(c2)), wss(c1, csn(c2))), wa(wn(wss(csn(c2), c0)), wss(csn(c2), c1)))))

blocks.name: brovmptimex

thm brovmptimex(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wa(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c1, universe)))
  -| wceq(c2, cmpo(s0, s1, c3, c4, c5))
  -| wi(w0, wbr(c6, c7, c8))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(c7, co(c0, c2, c1)))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
} = {
  a1ii(wi(w0, wa(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c1, universe))), diffsc(s0, c3))
  a1ii(wi(w0, wa(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c1, universe))), diffsc(s1, c2))
  3syl(w0, wa(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c1, universe)), wbr(c6, co(c0, c2, c1), c8), wne(co(c0, c2, c1), emptycls))
  breqdi(c6, co(c0, c2, c1), c8, c7, w0)
  brne0(c6, co(c0, c2, c1), c8)
  necon1ai(co(c0, c2, c1), emptycls, wa(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c1, universe)))
  ovprc(c0, c1, c2)
  reldmmpt2(s0, s1, c2, c3, c4, c5)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm brovmptimex(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (w0 →(c0 ∈ 𝕌 ∧ c1 ∈ 𝕌))
  ⊣ c2 =(s0 ∈ c3, s1 ∈ c4 ↦ c5)
  ⊣ (w0 → c6[c7]c8)
  ⊣ (w0 → c7 =(c0[c2]c1))
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c3)
  ⊣ d(s1, c2)
  ⊣ d(s1, c3)
} = {
  a1ii((w0 →(c0 ∈ 𝕌 ∧ c1 ∈ 𝕌)), d(s0, c3))
  a1ii((w0 →(c0 ∈ 𝕌 ∧ c1 ∈ 𝕌)), d(s1, c2))
  3syl(w0, (c0 ∈ 𝕌 ∧ c1 ∈ 𝕌), c6[(c0[c2]c1)]c8, (c0[c2]c1)≠ ∅)
  breqdi(c6, (c0[c2]c1), c8, c7, w0)
  brne0(c6, (c0[c2]c1), c8)
  necon1ai((c0[c2]c1), emptycls, (c0 ∈ 𝕌 ∧ c1 ∈ 𝕌))
  ovprc(c0, c1, c2)
  reldmmpt2(s0, s1, c2, c3, c4, c5)
}

blocks.name: ntrclsbex
blocks.content: If (pseudo-)interior and (pseudo-)closure functions are related by the duality operator then the base set exists. (Contributed by RP, 21-May-2021.)

blocks.name: ntrclsrcomplex
blocks.content: The relative complement of the class ` S ` exists as a subset of the base set. (Contributed by RP, 25-Jun-2021.)

blocks.name: neik0imk0p
blocks.content: Kuratowski's K0 axiom implies K0'. Neighborhood version. Also a proof the dual KA axiom imples KA' when considering the convergents. (Contributed by RP, 28-Jun-2021.)

blocks.name: ntrk2imkb

  ex(wa(wss(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), cv(s0)), wss(cfv(c1, cv(s1)), cv(s1))), wceq(cin(cv(s0), cv(s1)), emptycls), wceq(cin(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), cfv(c1, cv(s1))), emptycls))
  syl(wa(wa(wss(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), cv(s0)), wss(cfv(c1, cv(s1)), cv(s1))), wceq(cin(cv(s0), cv(s1)), emptycls)), wceq(cin(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), cfv(c1, cv(s1))), emptycls), wss(cin(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), cfv(c1, cv(s1))), emptycls))
  sseqtrd(cin(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), cfv(c1, cv(s1))), emptycls, cin(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wa(wa(wss(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), cv(s0)), wss(cfv(c1, cv(s1)), cv(s1))), wceq(cin(cv(s0), cv(s1)), emptycls)))
  adantr(wa(wss(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), cv(s0)), wss(cfv(c1, cv(s1)), cv(s1))), wceq(cin(cv(s0), cv(s1)), emptycls), wss(cin(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), cfv(c1, cv(s1))), cin(cv(s0), cv(s1))))

blocks.origin:

  ineq1d(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), cfv(c1, cv(s1)), cfv(c1, emptycls), wceq(cv(s0), emptycls))
  fveq2(cv(s0), emptycls, c1)
  ax-mp(wb(wi(wceq(cin(emptycls, cv(s1)), emptycls), wceq(cin(cfv(c1, emptycls), cfv(c1, cv(s1))), emptycls)), wceq(cin(cfv(c1, emptycls), cfv(c1, cv(s1))), emptycls)), wceq(cin(emptycls, cv(s1)), emptycls))
  0in(cv(s1))
  pm5.5(wceq(cin(emptycls, cv(s1)), emptycls), wceq(cin(cfv(c1, emptycls), cfv(c1, cv(s1))), emptycls))
  eqeq1d(cin(cfv(c1, emptycls), cfv(c1, cv(s1))), emptycls, cin(cfv(c1, emptycls), cfv(c1, emptycls)), wceq(cv(s1), emptycls))
  ineq2d(cfv(c1, emptycls), cfv(c1, cv(s1)), cfv(c1, emptycls), wceq(cv(s1), emptycls))

blocks.origin:
thm ntrk0kbimka(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, co(cpw(c0), cmap, cpw(c0)))), wi(wa(wceq(cfv(c2, c0), c0), wral(s0, cpw(c0), wral(s1, cpw(c0), wi(wceq(cin(cv(s0), cv(s1)), emptycls), wceq(cin(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), cfv(c2, cv(s1))), emptycls))))), wceq(cfv(c2, emptycls), emptycls)))

} = {

blocks.name: clsk3nimkb
blocks.content: If the base set is not empty, axiom K3 does not imply KB. A concrete example with a pseudo-closure function of ` k = ( x e. ~P b |-> ( b \ x ) ) ` is given. (Contributed by RP, 16-Jun-2021.)
blocks.origin:

  fvmpt(s0, emptycls, cpw(c3o), c0, emptycls, cif(cpr(emptycls, c1o), cv(s0), wceq(cv(s0), csn(emptycls))))
  eqtrd(cif(cpr(emptycls, c1o), cv(s0), wceq(cv(s0), csn(emptycls))), emptycls, cif(cpr(emptycls, c1o), emptycls, wceq(emptycls, csn(emptycls))), wceq(cv(s0), emptycls))
  ifbieq2d(cpr(emptycls, c1o), cv(s0), emptycls, wceq(cv(s0), emptycls), wceq(cv(s0), csn(emptycls)), wceq(emptycls, csn(emptycls)))
  eqeq1(cv(s0), emptycls, csn(emptycls))
  id(wceq(cv(s0), emptycls))
  iffalsed(cpr(emptycls, c1o), emptycls, wceq(cv(s0), emptycls), wceq(emptycls, csn(emptycls)))
  neneqd(emptycls, csn(emptycls), wceq(cv(s0), emptycls))
  a1i(wceq(cv(s0), emptycls), wne(emptycls, csn(emptycls)))
  0nep0()
  0ex()
  diff.emptycls.s(s0)

thm clsk1indlem0(setvar s0, class c0) {
  ⊢ (c0 ` ∅)= ∅
  ⊣ c0 =(s0 ∈ P(3o)↦ if(s0 = { ∅ }, { ∅, 1o }, s0))
} = {
  ax-mp((c0 ` ∅)= ∅, ∅ ∈ P(3o))

  eqtrd(if(s0 = { ∅ }, { ∅, 1o }, s0), emptycls, if(∅ = { ∅ }, { ∅, 1o }, ∅), s0 = ∅)
  ifbieq2d({ ∅, 1o }, s0, emptycls, s0 = ∅, s0 = { ∅ }, ∅ = { ∅ })
  eqeq1(s0, emptycls, { ∅ })
  id(s0 = ∅)
  iffalsed({ ∅, 1o }, emptycls, s0 = ∅, ∅ = { ∅ })
  neneqd(emptycls, { ∅ }, s0 = ∅)
  a1i(s0 = ∅, ∅ ≠ { ∅ })
  0nep0()
  0ex()
  diff.emptycls.s(s0)
  diff.cpw.s(s0, c3o)

blocks.name: clsk1independent
blocks.content: For generalized closure functions, property K1 (isotony) is independent of the properties K0, K2, K3, K4. This contradicts a claim which appears in preprints of Table 2 in Bärbel M. R. Stadler and Peter F. Stadler. "Generalized Topological Spaces in Evolutionary Theory and Combinatorial Chemistry." J. Chem. Inf. Comput. Sci., 42:577-585, 2002. Proceedings MCC 2001, Dubrovnik. The same table row implying K1 follows from the other four appears in the supplemental materials Bärbel M. R. Stadler and Peter F. Stadler. "Basic Properties of Closure Spaces" 2001 on page 12. (Contributed by RP, 5-Jul-2021.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: neik0pk1imk0
blocks.content: Kuratowski's K0' and K1 axioms imply K0. Neighborhood version. (Contributed by RP, 3-Jun-2021.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: ntrclsk2
blocks.content: An interior function is contracting if and only if the closure function is expansive. (Contributed by RP, 9-Jun-2021.)

blocks.name: ntrclskb
blocks.content: The interiors of disjoint sets are disjoint if and only if the closures of sets that span the base set also span the base set. (Contributed by RP, 10-Jun-2021.)

blocks.name: ntrclsk3
blocks.content: The intersection of interiors of a every pair is a subset of the interior of the intersection of the pair if an only if the closure of the union of every pair is a subset of the union of closures of the pair. (Contributed by RP, 19-Jun-2021.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: ntrclsk13
blocks.content: The interior of the intersection of any pair is equal to the intersection of the interiors if and only if the closure of the unions of any pair is equal to the union of closures. (Contributed by RP, 19-Jun-2021.)

thm ntrneircomplex(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, wff w0) {

  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s4)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s4)

}

  ⊢ (w0 →(∃(s0 ∈ P(c0), ¬ c1 ∈(c2 ` s0))↔(c3 ` c1)≠ P(c0)))

  bitrd(w0, ∃(s0 ∈ P(c0), ¬ c1 ∈(c2 ` s0)), (c3 ` c1)≠ P(c0), ∃(s0 ∈ P(c0), ¬ s0 ∈(c3 ` c1)))

  simpr(w0, s0 ∈ P(c0))
  3bitr4g(w0, ∃(s0 ∈ P(c0), ¬ s0 ∈(c3 ` c1)), (c3 ` c1)≠ P(c0), ¬ P(c0)⊆(c3 ` c1), (¬(c3 ` c1)⊆ P(c0)∨ ¬ P(c0)⊆(c3 ` c1)))
  syl(w0, (¬ P(c0)⊆(c3 ` c1)↔(¬(c3 ` c1)⊆ P(c0)∨ ¬ P(c0)⊆(c3 ` c1))), (c3 ` c1)⊆ P(c0))

  elmapi(c3, P(P(c0)), c0)

  bitr4i(∃(s0 ∈ P(c0), ¬ s0 ∈(c3 ` c1)), ¬ P(c0)⊆(c3 ` c1), ∃(s0,(s0 ∈ P(c0)∧ ¬ s0 ∈(c3 ` c1))))

blocks.name: ntrneiel2
blocks.content: Membership in iterated interior of a set is equivalent to there existing a particular neighborhood of that member such that points are members of that neighborhood if and only if the set is a neighborhood of each of those points. (Contributed by RP, 11-Jul-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm ntrneiel2(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5, setvar s6, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, wff w0) {

  -| wceq(c5, cmpo(s2, s3, universe, universe, cmpt(s4, co(cpw(cv(s3)), cmap, cv(s2)), cmpt(s5, cv(s3), crab(s6, cv(s2), wcel(cv(s5), cfv(cv(s4), cv(s6))))))))
  -| wceq(c6, co(cpw(c4), c5, c4))

blocks.name: ntrneiiso
blocks.content: If (pseudo-)interior and (pseudo-)neighborhood functions are related by the operator, ` F ` , then conditions equal to claiming that the interior function is isotonic hold equally. (Contributed by RP, 3-Jun-2021.)

blocks.name: ntrneikb
blocks.content: The interiors of disjoint sets are disjoint if and only if the neighborhoods of every point contain no disjoint sets. (Contributed by RP, 11-Jun-2021.)

blocks.name: ntrneixb
blocks.content: The interiors (closures) of sets that span the base set also span the base set if and only if the neighborhoods (convergents) of every point contain at least one of every pair of sets that span the base set. (Contributed by RP, 11-Jun-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm ntrneixb(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5, setvar s6, setvar s7, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wb(wral(s0, cpw(c0), wral(s1, cpw(c0), wi(wceq(cun(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c0), wceq(cun(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), cfv(c1, cv(s1))), c0)))), wral(s2, c0, wral(s0, cpw(c0), wral(s1, cpw(c0), wi(wceq(cun(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c0), wo(wcel(cv(s0), cfv(c2, cv(s2))), wcel(cv(s1), cfv(c2, cv(s2))))))))))
  -| wceq(c3, cmpo(s3, s4, universe, universe, cmpt(s5, co(cpw(cv(s4)), cmap, cv(s3)), cmpt(s6, cv(s4), crab(s7, cv(s3), wcel(cv(s6), cfv(cv(s5), cv(s7))))))))
  -| wceq(c4, co(cpw(c0), c3, c0))
  -| wi(w0, wbr(c1, c4, c2))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s4)
  -| diffss(s0, s5)
  -| diffss(s0, s6)
  -| diffss(s0, s7)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s4)

blocks.name: ntrneik3
blocks.content: The intersection of interiors of any pair is a subset of the interior of the intersection if and only if the intersection of any two neighborhoods of a point is also a neighborhood. (Contributed by RP, 19-Jun-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm ntrneik3(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5, setvar s6, setvar s7, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wb(wral(s0, cpw(c0), wral(s1, cpw(c0), wss(cin(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), cfv(c1, cv(s1))), cfv(c1, cin(cv(s0), cv(s1)))))), wral(s2, c0, wral(s0, cpw(c0), wral(s1, cpw(c0), wi(wa(wcel(cv(s0), cfv(c2, cv(s2))), wcel(cv(s1), cfv(c2, cv(s2)))), wcel(cin(cv(s0), cv(s1)), cfv(c2, cv(s2)))))))))
  -| wceq(c3, cmpo(s3, s4, universe, universe, cmpt(s5, co(cpw(cv(s4)), cmap, cv(s3)), cmpt(s6, cv(s4), crab(s7, cv(s3), wcel(cv(s6), cfv(cv(s5), cv(s7))))))))
  -| wceq(c4, co(cpw(c0), c3, c0))
  -| wi(w0, wbr(c1, c4, c2))

blocks.name: ntrneix3
blocks.content: The closure of the union of any pair is a subset of the union of closures if and only if the union of any pair belonging to the convergents of a point implies at least one of the pair belongs to the the convergents of that point. (Contributed by RP, 19-Jun-2021.)

blocks.name: ntrneik13
blocks.content: The interior of the intersection of any pair equals intersection of interiors if and only if the intersection of any pair belonging to the neighborhood of a point is equivalent to both of the pair belonging to the neighborhood of that point. (Contributed by RP, 19-Jun-2021.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: ntrneix13
blocks.content: The closure of the union of any pair is equal to the union of closures if and only if the union of any pair belonging to the convergents of a point if equivalent to at least one of the pain belonging to the convergents of that point. (Contributed by RP, 19-Jun-2021.)

blocks.name: ntrneik4w
blocks.content: Idempotence of the interior function is equivalent to saying a set is a neighborhood of a point if and only if the interior of the set is a neighborhood of a point. (Contributed by RP, 11-Jul-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm ntrneik4w(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5, setvar s6, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wb(wral(s0, cpw(c0), wceq(cfv(c1, cfv(c1, cv(s0))), cfv(c1, cv(s0)))), wral(s1, c0, wral(s0, cpw(c0), wb(wcel(cv(s0), cfv(c2, cv(s1))), wcel(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), cfv(c2, cv(s1))))))))
  -| wceq(c3, cmpo(s2, s3, universe, universe, cmpt(s4, co(cpw(cv(s3)), cmap, cv(s2)), cmpt(s5, cv(s3), crab(s6, cv(s2), wcel(cv(s5), cfv(cv(s4), cv(s6))))))))
  -| wceq(c4, co(cpw(c0), c3, c0))
  -| wi(w0, wbr(c1, c4, c2))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s4)

blocks.name: ntrneik4
blocks.content: Idempotence of the interior function is equivalent to stating a set, ` s ` , is a neighborhood of a point, ` x ` is equivalent to there existing a special neighborhood, ` u ` , of ` x ` such that a point is an element of the special neighborhood if and only if ` s ` is also a neighborhood of the point. (Contributed by RP, 11-Jul-2021.)

blocks.name: clsneibex
blocks.content: If (pseudo-)closure and (pseudo-)neighborhood functions are related by the composite operator, ` H ` , then the base set exists. (Contributed by RP, 4-Jun-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm clsneibex(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(c0, universe))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(c2, c0))
  -| wceq(c3, ccom(c4, c1))
  -| wi(w0, wbr(c5, c3, c6))
} = {
  3syl(w0, wcel(c0, universe), wbr(c5, ccom(c4, cfv(c2, c0)), c6), wne(ccom(c4, cfv(c2, c0)), emptycls))
  breqdi(c5, ccom(c4, cfv(c2, c0)), c6, c3, w0)
  a1i(w0, wceq(c3, ccom(c4, cfv(c2, c0))))
  eqtri(c3, ccom(c4, cfv(c2, c0)), ccom(c4, c1))
  coeq2i(c4, c1, cfv(c2, c0))
  brne0(c5, ccom(c4, cfv(c2, c0)), c6)
  necon1ai(ccom(c4, cfv(c2, c0)), emptycls, wcel(c0, universe))
  coemptyd(c4, cfv(c2, c0), wn(wcel(c0, universe)))
  syl6eq(cin(cdm(c4), crn(cfv(c2, c0))), emptycls, cin(cdm(c4), emptycls), wn(wcel(c0, universe)))
  ineq2d(cdm(c4), crn(cfv(c2, c0)), emptycls, wn(wcel(c0, universe)))
  syl6eq(crn(cfv(c2, c0)), emptycls, crn(emptycls), wn(wcel(c0, universe)))
  rneqd(cfv(c2, c0), emptycls, wn(wcel(c0, universe)))
  fvprc(c0, c2)
  rn0()
  in0(cdm(c4))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm clsneibex(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (w0 → c0 ∈ 𝕌)
  ⊣ c1 =(c2 ` c0)
  ⊣ c3 =(c4 ∘ c1)
  ⊣ (w0 → c5[c3]c6)
} = {
  3syl(w0, c0 ∈ 𝕌, c5[(c4 ∘(c2 ` c0))]c6, (c4 ∘(c2 ` c0))≠ ∅)
  breqdi(c5, (c4 ∘(c2 ` c0)), c6, c3, w0)
  a1i(w0, c3 =(c4 ∘(c2 ` c0)))

  diff.universe.s(s7)
}

blocks.name: clsneiel1
blocks.content: If a (pseudo-)closure function and a (pseudo-)neighborhood function are related by the ` H ` operator, then membership in the closure of a subset is equivalent to the complement of the subset not being a neighborhood of the point. (Contributed by RP, 7-Jun-2021.)

blocks.name: clsneiel2
blocks.content: If a (pseudo-)closure function and a (pseudo-)neighborhood function are related by the ` H ` operator, then membership in the closure of the complement of a subset is equivalent to the subset not being a neighborhood of the point. (Contributed by RP, 7-Jun-2021.)

blocks.name: neicvgbex
blocks.content: If (pseudo-)neighborhood and (pseudo-)convergent functions are related by the composite operator, ` H ` , then the base set exists. (Contributed by RP, 4-Jun-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm neicvgbex(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(c0, universe))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(c2, c0))
  -| wceq(c3, ccom(c4, ccom(c1, c5)))
  -| wi(w0, wbr(c6, c3, c7))
} = {
  3syl(w0, wcel(c0, universe), wbr(c6, ccom(c4, ccom(cfv(c2, c0), c5)), c7), wne(ccom(c4, ccom(cfv(c2, c0), c5)), emptycls))
  breqdi(c6, ccom(c4, ccom(cfv(c2, c0), c5)), c7, c3, w0)
  a1i(w0, wceq(c3, ccom(c4, ccom(cfv(c2, c0), c5))))
  eqtri(c3, ccom(c4, ccom(cfv(c2, c0), c5)), ccom(c4, ccom(c1, c5)))
  coeq2i(c4, ccom(c1, c5), ccom(cfv(c2, c0), c5))
  coeq1i(c1, c5, cfv(c2, c0))
  brne0(c6, ccom(c4, ccom(cfv(c2, c0), c5)), c7)
  necon1ai(ccom(c4, ccom(cfv(c2, c0), c5)), emptycls, wcel(c0, universe))
  coemptyd(c4, ccom(cfv(c2, c0), c5), wn(wcel(c0, universe)))
  syl6eq(cin(cdm(c4), crn(ccom(cfv(c2, c0), c5))), emptycls, cin(cdm(c4), emptycls), wn(wcel(c0, universe)))
  ineq2d(cdm(c4), crn(ccom(cfv(c2, c0), c5)), emptycls, wn(wcel(c0, universe)))
  syl6eq(crn(ccom(cfv(c2, c0), c5)), emptycls, crn(emptycls), wn(wcel(c0, universe)))
  rneqd(ccom(cfv(c2, c0), c5), emptycls, wn(wcel(c0, universe)))
  coemptyd(cfv(c2, c0), c5, wn(wcel(c0, universe)))
  syl6eq(cin(cdm(cfv(c2, c0)), crn(c5)), emptycls, cin(emptycls, crn(c5)), wn(wcel(c0, universe)))
  ineq1d(cdm(cfv(c2, c0)), crn(c5), emptycls, wn(wcel(c0, universe)))
  syl6eq(cdm(cfv(c2, c0)), emptycls, cdm(emptycls), wn(wcel(c0, universe)))
  dmeqd(cfv(c2, c0), emptycls, wn(wcel(c0, universe)))
  fvprc(c0, c2)
  dm0()
  eqtri(cin(emptycls, crn(c5)), emptycls, cin(crn(c5), emptycls))
  incom(emptycls, crn(c5))
  in0(crn(c5))
  rn0()
  in0(cdm(c4))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm neicvgbex(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (w0 → c0 ∈ 𝕌)
  ⊣ c1 =(c2 ` c0)
  ⊣ c3 =(c4 ∘(c1 ∘ c5))
  ⊣ (w0 → c6[c3]c7)
} = {
  3syl(w0, c0 ∈ 𝕌, c6[(c4 ∘((c2 ` c0)∘ c5))]c7, (c4 ∘((c2 ` c0)∘ c5))≠ ∅)
  breqdi(c6, (c4 ∘((c2 ` c0)∘ c5)), c7, c3, w0)
  a1i(w0, c3 =(c4 ∘((c2 ` c0)∘ c5)))
  eqtri(c3, (c4 ∘((c2 ` c0)∘ c5)), (c4 ∘(c1 ∘ c5)))
  coeq2i(c4, (c1 ∘ c5), ((c2 ` c0)∘ c5))
  coeq1i(c1, c5, (c2 ` c0))
  brne0(c6, (c4 ∘((c2 ` c0)∘ c5)), c7)
  necon1ai((c4 ∘((c2 ` c0)∘ c5)), emptycls, c0 ∈ 𝕌)
  coemptyd(c4, ((c2 ` c0)∘ c5), ¬ c0 ∈ 𝕌)
  syl6eq((dom(c4)⋂ ran(((c2 ` c0)∘ c5))), emptycls, (dom(c4)⋂ ∅), ¬ c0 ∈ 𝕌)
  ineq2d(dom(c4), ran(((c2 ` c0)∘ c5)), emptycls, ¬ c0 ∈ 𝕌)
  syl6eq(ran(((c2 ` c0)∘ c5)), emptycls, ran(∅), ¬ c0 ∈ 𝕌)
  rneqd(((c2 ` c0)∘ c5), emptycls, ¬ c0 ∈ 𝕌)
  coemptyd((c2 ` c0), c5, ¬ c0 ∈ 𝕌)
  syl6eq((dom((c2 ` c0))⋂ ran(c5)), emptycls, (∅ ⋂ ran(c5)), ¬ c0 ∈ 𝕌)
  ineq1d(dom((c2 ` c0)), ran(c5), emptycls, ¬ c0 ∈ 𝕌)
  syl6eq(dom((c2 ` c0)), emptycls, dom(∅), ¬ c0 ∈ 𝕌)
  dmeqd((c2 ` c0), emptycls, ¬ c0 ∈ 𝕌)
  fvprc(c0, c2)
  dm0()
  eqtri((∅ ⋂ ran(c5)), emptycls, (ran(c5)⋂ ∅))
  incom(emptycls, ran(c5))
  in0(ran(c5))
  rn0()
  in0(dom(c4))
}

blocks.name: neicvgrcomplex
blocks.content: The relative complement of the class ` S ` exists as a subset of the base set. (Contributed by RP, 26-Jun-2021.)

blocks.name: neicvgf1o
blocks.content: If neighborhood and convergent functions are related by operator ` H ` , it is a one-to-one onto relation. (Contributed by RP, 11-Jun-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm neicvgf1o(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5, setvar s6, setvar s7, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wf1o(c0, co(cpw(cpw(c1)), cmap, c1), co(cpw(cpw(c1)), cmap, c1)))
  -| wceq(c2, cmpo(s0, s1, universe, universe, cmpt(s2, co(cpw(cv(s1)), cmap, cv(s0)), cmpt(s3, cv(s1), crab(s4, cv(s0), wcel(cv(s3), cfv(cv(s2), cv(s4))))))))
  -| wceq(c3, cmpt(s5, universe, cmpt(s6, co(cpw(cv(s5)), cmap, cpw(cv(s5))), cmpt(s7, cpw(cv(s5)), cdif(cv(s5), cfv(cv(s6), cdif(cv(s5), cv(s7))))))))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(c3, c1))
  -| wceq(c5, co(cpw(c1), c2, c1))
  -| wceq(c6, co(c1, c2, cpw(c1)))
  -| wceq(c0, ccom(c5, ccom(c4, c6)))
  -| wi(w0, wbr(c7, c0, c8))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)

thm neicvgnvo(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5, setvar s6, setvar s7, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, wff w0) {

thm neicvgnvo(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5, setvar s6, setvar s7, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (w0 → `' c0 = c0)
  ⊣ c1 =(s0 ∈ 𝕌, s1 ∈ 𝕌 ↦(s2 ∈(P(s1)[↦]s0)↦(s3 ∈ s1 ↦ { s4 ∈ s0 | s3 ∈(s2 ` s4)})))

  syl6eq(`' c0, c0, ((c5 ∘ c3)∘ c6), w0)

  dssmapnvod(s5, s6, s7, c3, c2, c4, universe, w0)
  fsovcnvd(s0, s1, s2, s3, s4, c5, c6, c1, P(c4), universe, c4, universe, w0)

  mp1i(wcel(c0, ctop), wfn(cmpt(hs0, cpw(c2), cuni(cin(c0, cpw(cv(hs0))))), cpw(c2)), wral(hs0, cpw(c2), wcel(cuni(cin(c0, cpw(cv(hs0)))), universe)))
  rgenw(hs0, cpw(c2), wcel(cuni(cin(c0, cpw(cv(hs0)))), universe))
  uniex(cin(c0, cpw(cv(hs0))))
  inex2(c0, cpw(cv(hs0)))
  vpwex(hs0)
  fnmptf(hs0, cpw(c2), cuni(cin(c0, cpw(cv(hs0)))), universe)
  nfcv(hs0, cpw(c2))
  fneq1d(cfv(cnt, c0), cpw(c2), cmpt(hs0, cpw(c2), cuni(cin(c0, cpw(cv(hs0))))), wcel(c0, ctop))
  ntrfval(hs0, c0, c2)
  ralrimiv(hs0, cpw(c2), wcel(c0, ctop), wcel(cfv(cfv(cnt, c0), cv(hs0)), c0))
  syl5(wcel(c0, ctop), wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c2)), wcel(cfv(cfv(cnt, c0), cv(hs0)), c0), wss(cv(hs0), c2))
  elpwi(cv(hs0), c2)

  clsf(c0, c2)
  sylbb1(((cls ` c0): P(c2)→(Clsd ` c0)), (c1[Fn]P(c2)∧ ran(c1)⊆(Clsd ` c0)), (c1 : P(c2)→(Clsd ` c0)))
  feq1i(c1, P(c2), (Clsd ` c0), (cls ` c0))
  df-f(c1, P(c2), (Clsd ` c0))
  anim2i(c1[Fn]P(c2), ran(c1)⊆(Clsd ` c0), ran(c1)⊆ P(c2))

}

blocks.name: clselmap
blocks.content: The closure function is a map from the powerset of the base set to itself. (Contributed by RP, 22-Apr-2021.)

thm dssmapntrcls(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ Top → c1 =(c2 ` c3))
  ⊣ c4 = ⋃ c0
  ⊣ c3 =(cls ` c0)
  ⊣ c1 =(int ` c0)
  ⊣ c5 =(s0 ∈ 𝕌 ↦(s1 ∈(P(s0)[↦]P(s0))↦(s2 ∈ P(s0)↦(s0 \(s1 `(s0 \ s2))))))
  ⊣ c2 =(c5 ` c4)
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, s2)
  ⊣ d(s1, s2)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c4)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c3)
  ⊣ d(s1, c4)
  ⊣ d(s2, c0)
  ⊣ d(s2, c3)
  ⊣ d(s2, c4)
} = {
  eqfnfvd(hs0, c1, (c2 ` c3), P(c4), c0 ∈ Top)
  mpbird(c0 ∈ Top, c1[Fn]P(c4), (hs0 ∈ P(c4)↦ ⋃(c0 ⋂ P(hs0)))[Fn]P(c4))
  mp1i(c0 ∈ Top, (hs0 ∈ P(c4)↦ ⋃(c0 ⋂ P(hs0)))[Fn]P(c4), ∀(hs0 ∈ P(c4), ⋃(c0 ⋂ P(hs0))∈ 𝕌))
  rgenw(hs0, P(c4), ⋃(c0 ⋂ P(hs0))∈ 𝕌)
  uniex((c0 ⋂ P(hs0)))
  inex2(c0, P(hs0))
  vpwex(hs0)
  fnmptf(hs0, P(c4), ⋃(c0 ⋂ P(hs0)), universe)
  nfcv(hs0, P(c4))
  fneq1d(c1, P(c4), (hs0 ∈ P(c4)↦ ⋃(c0 ⋂ P(hs0))), c0 ∈ Top)
  syl5eq(c1, (hs0 ∈ P(c4)↦ ⋃(c0 ⋂ P(hs0))), (int ` c0), c0 ∈ Top)
  ntrfval(hs0, c0, c4)
  syl(c0 ∈ Top, (c2 ` c3)[Fn]P(c4), (c2 ` c3)∈(P(c4)[↦]P(c4)))
  ffvelrnd(c2, c3, (P(c4)[↦]P(c4)), (P(c4)[↦]P(c4)), c0 ∈ Top)
  syl(c0 ∈ Top, (c2 :(P(c4)[↦]P(c4))→(P(c4)[↦]P(c4))), (c2 :(P(c4)[↦]P(c4))↔(P(c4)[↦]P(c4))))
  dssmapf1od(s0, s1, s2, c2, c4, c5, c0, c0 ∈ Top)
  f1of(c2, (P(c4)[↦]P(c4)), (P(c4)[↦]P(c4)))
  elmapfn((c2 ` c3), P(c4), P(c4))
  eqtr4d((c1 ` hs0), ((c2 ` c3)` hs0), (c4 \(c3 `(c4 \ hs0))), (c0 ∈ Top ∧ hs0 ∈ P(c4)))
  3eqtr4g((c1 ` hs0), (c4 \(c3 `(c4 \ hs0))), ((int ` c0)` hs0), (c4 \((cls ` c0)`(c4 \ hs0))), (c0 ∈ Top ∧ hs0 ∈ P(c4)))
  sylan2(c0 ∈ Top, hs0 ∈ P(c4), ((int ` c0)` hs0)=(c4 \((cls ` c0)`(c4 \ hs0))), hs0 ⊆ c4)
  elpwi(hs0, c4)
  ntrval2(c0, hs0, c4)
  fveq1i(c1, hs0, (int ` c0))
  difeq2i(c4, (c3 `(c4 \ hs0)), ((cls ` c0)`(c4 \ hs0)))
  fveq1i(c3, (c4 \ hs0), (cls ` c0))
  dssmapfv3d(s0, s1, s2, ((c2 ` c3)` hs0), c4, c3, hs0, c5, c2, c0, (c2 ` c3), (c0 ∈ Top ∧ hs0 ∈ P(c4)))
  adantr(c0 ∈ Top, hs0 ∈ P(c4), c4 ∈ c0)
  topopn(c0, c4)
  adantr(c0 ∈ Top, hs0 ∈ P(c4), c3 ∈(P(c4)[↦]P(c4)))
  clselmap(c0, c3, c4)
  eqid((c2 ` c3))
  simpr(c0 ∈ Top, hs0 ∈ P(c4))
  eqid(((c2 ` c3)` hs0))
  diff.hs0.c(c1)

thm dssmapclsntr(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {

thm dssmapclsntr(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ Top → c1 =(c2 ` c3))
  ⊣ c4 = ⋃ c0
